pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.1.3: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.1.4: At that time the Master had allowed the sitting-mat for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.1.6: Knowing this, the monks from the group of six used over-sized sitting-mats.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.1.7: They let them hang down from beds and benches, both in front and behind.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.1.8: The monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.1.9: “How can the monks from the group of six use over-sized sitting-mats?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.1.10: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.1.13: Foolish men, how can you use over-sized sitting-mats?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.1.14: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.1.15: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.1.17: ‘If a monk is getting a sitting-mat made, it is to be made to the right size.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.1.18: This is the right size: 50 centimeters long and 37.5 centimeters wide.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.1.19: If it exceeds that, it is to be cut down, and he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.1.20: In this way the Master laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.1.2: At that time Venerable Udāyī was big.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.1.3: After putting out his sitting-mat in front of the Master, he stretched it on all sides before sitting down.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.1.5: “Udāyī, why are you stretching the sitting-mat on all sides,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.1.6: as if it was an old hide?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.1.7: “It is, Venerable Sir, because the sitting-mat you’ve allowed for the monks is too small.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.1.8: Soon afterwards the Master gave a teaching and addressed the monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.1.9: “Monks, I allow a border of 25 centimeters for the sitting-mat.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.1.10: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.1.11: ‘If a monk is getting a sitting-mat made, it should be made to the right size.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.1.12: This is the right size: 50 centimeters long and 37.5 centimeters wide, and a border of 25 centimeters.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.1.13: If it exceeds that, it is to be cut down, and he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.2: one with a border is what is meant.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.4: making it himself or getting someone else to make it, it should be made to the right size.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.5: This is the right size: 50 centimeters long and 37.5 centimeters wide, and a border of 25 centimeters.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.6: If he makes one or gets one made that exceeds that, then the effort constitutes wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.7: When he obtains it, it is to be cut down, and he is then to confess an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.8: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.9: If he gets others to finish what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.10: If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.11: If he gets others to finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.12: If he makes one or gets one made for the benefit of someone else, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.13: If he obtains one that was made by someone else and then uses it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.2.2: if he makes it the right size;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.2.3: if he makes it less than the right size;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.2.4: if he obtains one made by another that exceeds the right size and he cuts it down before using it;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.2.5: if he makes a canopy, a floor cover, a cloth screen, a mattress, or a pillow;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.2.7: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.2.8: The seventh rule, the training rule on sitting-mats, is finished.
